Early Access Review

This game is a very fast-paced, addicting and widely multiplayer mix between a Bullet Hell shooter and an RPG. It's fun to play with your pals in front of one screen and on one couch to enjoy the game.

One of the most notable features of Crawl is its extreme replay value. Everybody loves getting rewarded even if they lost, so the game will always intensify after every time you play, which adds more possibilities for a character! The 0.3 update was very useful, because it doesn't take long to unlock everything in v0.2 and especially v0.1. v0.3 added some dieties, evolutions and even an alternate boss that can be very useful and effective. But that's what's best about this game: the frequent updates! But, one of the most well-known features is the awesome animations and the retro feel. The animatons are indescribable. They are the smoothest out of every single pixel-graphic game I've ever seen.

Thus, I rate this game an 11/10. That's right. 11/10. Never stop being awesome, Powerhoof!

Early Access Review

This game is great and keeps getting better with each update. Well worth the $9.99.

Pros:
-Each time through is different
-Good variety of weapons, monsters, traps, and spells
-Great fun with a group of friends
-Unlocking new items and features after every session makes it hard not to start up another session just to see what the new stuff does
-Plays quick (about 30 - 60 minutes) for a session
-Very polished already and very few minor bugs

Cons:
-No online support yet: I can't play it with friends who don't live near by : (
-Music variety: Good music but there is only a few tracks
-Scenery variety: The rooms always uses the same brown brick and tile, a variety of different backgrounds would be nice.

Mixed Bag:
-Your aim is always in the same direction as your movement. This keeps the game controls from becoming overly complex, but it prevent you from back-peddling while firing a projectile attack.
-Fights can become super chaotic, and it becomes very easy to lose track of your character.  Sometimes this adds to the fun and other times it can be a little frustrating.

This game is supposed to support controllers fully,but it doesn't work very well.Impossible to bind controls on a single controller,pressing a single button activates the controller for Player 1,but pressing another different button (which you have to do to bind the controls) activates the controller for Player 2 also.Try pressing ESC to cancel it,it activates the keyboard for Player 3.Try to click on something to go back,it activates the mouse for player 4.Although it seems possible to bind controls by clumsily binding 1 controller to 1,using ALT+F4 to return to steam,re-launching and repeating the process,for me it would glitch at the 3rd controller and controller 1&2 would get mixed up.

My controllers work perfectly as xbox 360 wired controllers on every other single game I own,so I'm pretty sure it's not a problem on my part.Complete shame as this game looks really fun.


EDIT :

Last night I got drunk with my friends,and we were bored so I thought I'd reinstall Crawl to see if it worked,and guess what- it did. No idea why,I desinstalled and reinstalled it about 20 times before but for some reason,my controllers get properly recognised now (maybe a patch was released,I don't know)

So the review then:

- This game is really fun.It's a bit difficult to understand and to explain (especially when playing with non english speakers) but the learning curve isn't too steep.
-The mechanics are really engaging and you won't find yourself watching your friends have fun,some times you'll prefer playing as a monster because who doesn't want to be able to be a dragon,a lovecraftian-cthulhu-mind flayer,or a giant skeleton knight ?
-I just started but it seems like there is a LOT to unlock in this game.Combos with skills/trinkets are pretty cool though sometimes imbalanced (raging bull + haunted axe x 3 = GG GL HF)  but it's a party game,not a competitive game.
-The versus doesn't just inculde monsters vs human.You'll often try to steal a kill to regain your humanity,but when the human player has to fight a boss,you'll cooperate to make sure he doesn't win.

I didn't quite understand how you reach the final struggle(game ends after that,which caught us off guard as we thought we could re-try the final boss several times) but hopefully I'll find an answer in the forums.It's definitely a multiplayer game though,so I wouldn't recommend buying it if you don't have anyone willing to play with you,the bots are fairly easy to beat.

Early Access Review

WARNING!: COMPLETELY EXPLANATORY, MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS!

If this game had existed on the SNES or the Genesis or even Personal Computers in 1995, I'm not sure anyone would have played any other game.

The concept is truly original. Up to four players can play at a time. 1-3 play as the spirits inhabiting the dungeon, and they attempt to destroy the Hero who is trying to conquer the dungeon by controlling traps and summoning monsters. The more blood from the Hero that each spirit spills, the more they can offer to the gods in exchange for gold. Once the Hero is defeated, the spirit who delivered the killing blow now takes his place. The new Hero can take all the blood spilled from the old hero as an offering and receive gold which can buy new items like weapons, spell tomes, potions, armor, and charms. This essentially leads to a race for level 10 as the Hero. However, at the end of each floor, for each level the Hero has risen, the spirits are given points to level their monsters. Whom ever can level their hero form to 10 can open the portal to the final boss, Kurok. Kurok can be controlled by all three spirit players simultaneously, and will provide and extreme challenge to the Hero with weapons like toxic sludge, trap bubbles, and a humongous eye laser. Each run of the game, no matter who attempts to defeat Kurok, there can only be three attempts to defeat Kurok before he unleashes his wrath upon the world. If all three attempts fail, Kurok will break lose, and all players lose. The lowest scoring player of the game has their in-game profile permanently erased.

Whilst I still have not unlocked every God in the game, this has become my favorite party game ever. When you find yourself smiling at the person who is playing Hero, saying to them I'm definitely going to kill you"
date: it creates a special moment. This game has created the most friendly gamer rivalry I have ever experienced. The localized experience that the players get is absolutely incredible. It does not take long to understand how the game works. Then
hoursPlayed: the participants can still find themselves discovering new items popping up in the blacksmith shop.\n\nI still find this game incredible
voteText: and I've recommended it to many friends. We all agree
helpfulPercent: it creates the best and most friendly kind of game rivalry we have ever experienced."

Early Access Review

There's not much about this game that hasn't already been said. Everything currently in the game is extremely tight, polished, well-balanced and incredibly fun. I only have a few gripes.

Play if you're looking for:
Local MP with some beers and some buds.
Polished dungeon crawling with excellent controls.
Competition.
Monster evolution.
A game where you get to be the bad guys/bosses.

Don't play if you:
Have no local friends to play with.
Don't have a controller.
Don't like pixel games.

As I have said, everything in the game is amazing. The only problem I have is what's NOT in the game. For this to really hit just the right spot, it really only needs more content. The developers are releasing updates every several weeks, however, so this shouldn't be a problem for long. I would personally like to see more than one boss, as there is only a single one right now.

In time, I would also like to see the life of the game sessions expanded a bit. I'm certain it's a lot more fun with a full party, but if your game consists of only two players it is over quite quickly. The monster evolution trees can be fairly short and the requirement to unlock the boss is easy to attain. I would like to see an option wherein you can increase the level required to access the boss.

The mouse and keyboard controls are also terrible independently. You can either pick the keyboard or the mouse, but not both. An option to combine these two would solve the problem (WASD to move, mouse to attack).
Early Access Review\n\nFor parties, this is propably on par  with  or even better than mario kart, wouldnt recommend it for solo play though.

I'm a career author, and I want to steal this game's ideas.

I mean, holy ♥♥♥♥ are you kidding me?  Watch the trailer, with audio - listen to this man.  Listen to him rant like a mad god trapped beneath the earth.  MARK HIM.

The thematics of this game are on point!  The whole thing has this 'cursed NES cartridge' motif going that I think is brilliant.  It's honestly inspiring a horror novel in my head as we speak.  We'll see where that goes.

The gameplay is brilliant and unique, intense with just one friend to play local with a controller.  Even alone, it's bizarre and beautiful.  This is another indie Dark Fantasy title that's joining a few others in squirming out from the depths - oh, I could not be happier for this black tide.

You'll see.  You'll all see.

Early Access Review

Crawl is awesome to play alone and much more awsesome to play with friends.
You have to choose a monster leader at the beginning.
This monster leader has got his theam of 3 monsters wich can be leveled up for ''wrath'' poins witch you can get if the other player levels up.
Every stage has got a portal room, a shop and of course a staircase to the next stage.
You can activate the portal to the boss if you have reached level 10.
In the shop you can buy 3 weapons ([ 1. attak ]e.g.: a sword, a bow. an axe), 2 spells ([ 2. attak ] different effect) , 2 potions (e.g.: healt, streanght, speed ) and 3 artefacts ( different effect).
You can have only 1 weapon and 1 spell at the time.
In total the boss can be fightin 3 times.
If the human beats by the goasts controlled boss he automaticlly wins but if the boss survives 3 times he escapes and the player with the higerst level wins.

As a ghoast you are able to go in traps (e.g.: a crossbow on 3 wooden legs ) and pentagrams.
On a  pentagram you can spawn 1 your 3 monsters wich will be randomly chosen  by the game.
If you level up a monster he changes his look and attacks and gets stronger obviosly.
When a goast damages the human it get's gold.

If you are the human the you can get gold from chests, you can find them sometimes in rooms.
You can only level up, buy things in the shop, activate the portal to the boss and use the staircase when you are the human.
As the human you also decide in witch room to go.

You can change controlls at yourself in the option menu.
In the main menu you can find logs for every trap, monster and weapon.
There isn't online mode yet and I'm not sure if Powerhoof wants to add this mode.
Sorry for my writing mistackes and please dont be to hard on me because it's my first review.

Early Access Review

Can't recomend the game enough. The game is updated every few months providing plenty of time to test out the new additions and get used to the tweaks. The devs are active in the steam forums and are VERY open to discussion and reccomendations.

gameplay:
one player (chosen at random) controls the hero at the start, the other players are ghosts that control the monsters and traps.
dungeons are randomly generated and each room has a minimum pentagram(monster spawn point) equal to the number of players controlling ghosts.
each player has 3 monsters based on the god you choose to worship.
god can also provide a bonus to your hero character.
evolve monsters by damaging or effecting the hero.
branching monster evolution tree. While they are fairly limited there is still a large selection and every combination is possible.
definitely more fun with people but single player against AI is fun as well.

really the only negative is that when playing with 4 people it is possible for one player to be underleveled in one form or the other.
if the other 3 players are the only ones getting a chance at being the hero then the 4th player has higher level monsters but the lowest level hero fighting the higher level monsters. granted they will gain xp for killing the hero (which is usually enough for a 1-4 level up). the player would at this point have a massive stockpile of gold (also gained from harming the hero) and can purchase a large amount of upgrades provided they can find the store on that floor.

finding the store isnt dificult because the doors are marked with a red stairs (end of floor) blue portal (boss aka how to win the game) an anvil (shop) or a ? if an area is unexplored.

ranged weapons have been fixed from earlier versions where they were clunky but are now much smoother to use.

bosses: there are 2 bosses

a 3 headed hydra where each player controls a head

and a squid monster where one player controls the eye and the other 2 control tentacles.

great party game

Early Access Review

Crawl is a retro 8 bit pixel throwback with quite a gameplay twist.

The controls on gamepads are very simple, being the traditional A=attack and B=special, like a true child of the '80s. The gameplay is superb, though a bit tricky to get used to at first. (But hey, they're doing something new, so it will take a little bit of getting used to).

The ability of the player mobs to spawn on pentagrams is well thought out, but they also have the ability to take control of traps to further inhibit the Dungeoneer. This can become a bit of a cluster♥♥♥♥ if you have 3 enemy players, as some of the rooms are very small in regards to the amount of anti-hero objects in them.

The leveling up features seem pretty smooth, as well as the Wrath mechanics, and the shop. The Boss pentagram that appears on each level (accessible at lvl 10) sends you to a room where you battle one of many huge bosses. This can feel a bit like an attack-spam sometimes, but only if you are significantly prepared for the boss through the purchase of upgrades. It does still feel like a retro boss battle.

Overall I would give Crawl an 8/10

They are bringing something new and interesting to the table in the form of something familiar. It is a great game to play  alone, or with friends, and it's a great excuse to cuss your friends out when they booby trap kill you before the final room.

Early Access Review\n\nOverwhelmingly positive such a great game. One of the best co ops on pc or steam. idk what those 17 negative reviews say but i guarantee their all wrong.

recommended: what stops the player in the human flesh bag from just dawdling around and wasting everybody's time? You can do that but when the ghost players aren't otherwise occupied
hoursPlayed: they're always zooming back and forth gathering up ambient ectoplasm blobs which they can spend to summon slimes. Slimes are pretty pathetic but you can summon them in numbers as a distraction in larger fights and the hero doesn't get rewarded for killing them. Early Access Review\n\npossibly one of the best party games i have ever played. i love getting together with my friends and playing this when we can. Never a dull moment. always exciting. always hyped. cant wait to see the future development of this game. the biggest thing it could need is a good, supported online gameplay with public and private parties. 10/10. Early Access Review\n\nProbably the best way to spend an hour with the lads.

Early Access Review\n\nI don't often leave reviews for games, but for this one i will have to make an exception. Without a doubt this is my favorite game of the last year. It is easy to pick up and hard to master. The gameplay feels so beautifully intuitive and the addicting gameplay and soundtrack leaves me craving for more. It is one of the most perfectly designed retro-themed games ever and i have spent many nights (with and without friends over) going floor after floor on a quest to beat and unlock everything this game has to offer. I cannot put in words how truly fantastic this game is, and to whovever reads this, please do yourself a favor and buy the game. You won't be dissapointed.
Early Access Review\n\nEnjoy the game if you get it! It's amazing. :D

Early Access Review\n\nStill in early-access, but definitely playable in its current condition. So much fun with 4 players. Only complaint I've ever heard about the game is usually easily blames on the controller. Make sure you play on a functioning controller. I'd recommend an xbox 360 con't to be safe.
Early Access Review\n\n...

Early Access Review\n\nAll I have to say is that within a few days of buying this game, I've had over 10 hours of fun playing with my friends. This is a unique local multiplayer game to have for parties or just when you want to play games with someone other than yourself. You don't need controllers, since you can play up to 4-player with just one keyboard and mouse (though it does get tight on the keyboard if you only have 1). Just buy this game. Now.

Early Access Review\n\nThis is an incredible game and well worth the $10 price at its current state. Once it's finished and more content is added, it will be an even better deal. It's highly unique in its gameplay and very addictive. I was a little confused when I first started getting into it, but once the basic mechanics are understood, it's a blast. Buy this game. Seriously. Do it now.
Early Access Review\n\nOne of the most original games I've played in a long while. Lots of good fun to be had with this one.

Early Access Review

10/10 Great job overall.  Very fun and is a great game to play with friends.  I would suggest this game to everyone.
This game has the perfect balance between competative and casual with its skill cap and controlled randomness.  Even as a single player game it is really well done as the AI's are smart but still able to beaten.

I can't wait for future updates and a possible online multiplayer (I realize that would take a lot of work to add so might be a long time before that happens if ever).

It also feels like a game you would play in an arcade and I could see it being the most popular arcade game there.

The only improvements I could see from a user's point of view would be possible better explainations when playing as a ghost/monster.

Giant statue of Gabe Newell kills me and steals my wallet.


But seriously, local is great - got this game specifically for the Link. The trailers don't show half of the satisfying content this game contains. Buy this game purely on gut feeling, it seems the gameplay is boring to watch, but exciting to play. Early Access Review

Uhh, Did you watch that super hype trailer?

The game delivers on it.

Even if you don't have 3 buddies to play with, the a.i. is good enough to enjoy a match with. Although it does need a bit more work.  Which they are doing... They just fixed the bots never miss projectile aiming and increased their ability to deal with cheese.  Best played with other humans though, a.i. just won't ever be on our level of mind games and co-op.

Balance is fairly decent, I would say the better player is almost always going to win...  However any slack in balance is evened out a lot by the always changing 'alliances'.  Kingmaking isn't really an issue the majority of the time, because everyone feels like they have a chance at winning after a game or two.  Plenty of 'fair' handicapped choices for experienced players to choose against greenhorns as well.

Definitely falls into one of my top 10 games.
